intro: Hieracium retrodentatum, commonly known as the backward-toothed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium retrodentatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
